alert.note: Alert for Columbus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 5:55PM EST until December 17 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southeast North Carolina, including the following county, Columbus and northeast South Carolina, including the following county, Horry. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 555 PM EST, emergency management reported heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Whiteville, Tabor City, Chadbourn, Bethel, Lake Waccamaw, Fair Bluff, Boardman, Williams, Sidney, Clarendon, Southeastern Community College, Mollie, Nakina, Redbug, Cherry Grove, Hallsboro, Old Dock, Evergreen, Dulah and Bughill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
